definitions.definition: a period of seven days, especially either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturday:
the five days from Monday to Friday, the usual working period for many people:
examples: We're usually too tired to go out much during the week.

definitions.definition: one week after the day mentioned:
examples: The first performance of the play is a week (from) today/tomorrow.

definitions.definition: one week before the day mentioned:
examples: It was his birthday a week ago last Friday.

definitions.definition: the amount of hours spent working during a week or the number of days on which a person works:
examples: A lot of farm workers work a six-day week.

definitions.definition: each week during a period of time:
examples: We could see his health deteriorate week by week.

definitions.definition: regularly or continuously for many weeks:
examples: I go to aerobics three times a week, week in, week out.
